name: All or Nothing Coin
description: On a roll you would normally use a d20, flip a coin instead. Heads is a critical success (Natural 20), tails is a critical fail (Natural 1). Can be used once per short rest.

name: Mighty Acorn
description: When thrown on a patch of earth, at least 5 feet wide, it immediately grows into a 20' oak.

name: Paired Scrolls
description: As long as the scrolls are on the same plane, whatever is written on one scroll, appears on the other. Each scrolls can 'transmit' up to two sentences before becoming inactive for 24 hours. After 24 hours, anything written on the scrolls fade.

name: Ring of Tracking
description: A simple ring, when attuned to a user, the user knows the location of the ring at all times. Often used by merchants and collectors to keep track of their goods.

name: Companion Rock
description: A smooth grey stone that feels like a friend. When you throw it, it will find its way back to your pocket the next time you reach for it. If you place it on the ground, it will stay there.

name: Bag of Withholding
description:
This bag looks and functions exactly like a normal Bag of Holding, with double the interior capacity of up to 1000 pounds and 128 cubic feet.  This capacity comes at a cost, as a Bag of Withholding feels unappreciated, because players only want to talk to it when they want something.  The bag must be reassured of its value and importance in order to open up to release any item contained inside.

When attempting to retrieve any item in the Bag of Withholding, the player must succeed on a DC 14 persuasion check, or the bag will shut more tightly.  Each failure increases the DC of the next check by 1.  Successfully convincing the Bag of its importance will allow access for 1 minute, resetting the DC to 14 thereafter.  Regardless of the DC at the end of the day, the DC resets to 14 the following dawn, as the Bag of Withholding has had a chance to reconsider its feelings over the course of the night.

name: Infinite Coin Purse
description: A coin pouch that always sounds and feels as if it is full of coins, as long as there is at least one coin inside.

name: Perfume of Bewitching
description: A small vial of perfume that, when applied, gives the user advantage on all Charisma checks for 1 hour.

name: Pole of Collapsing
description: While holding this 10â€”foot pole, you can use an action to speak a command word and cause it to collapse into a l-foot-long rod, for ease of storage. The poles weight doesn't change. You can use an action to speak a different command word and cause the rod to revert to a pole; however, the rod will elongate only as far as the surrounding space allows.

name: Cloak of Elvenkind
description: While you wear this cloak with its hood up, Wisdom (Perception) checks made to see you have disadvantage, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, as the cloak's color shifts to camouflage you. Pulling the hood up or down requires an action.

name: Belt of Giant Strength (Hill Giant)
description: Your Strength score is 21 while you wear this belt. It has no effect on you if your Strength is already 21 or higher.
